discussion.content:
SDN=Software-Defined Networking. Its in the name "software." 
 API's= Application Programming Interface. = software
REST API's = isn't a specific API but a set of rules for API's 
SDKs= Software Development Kits

Enabling software to allow for external applications defiantly makes it more "extensible" (able to be extended). The traditional device management seemed to really want to keep things proprietary, or at least attempt a push in that direction. It appears now that Cisco knows it needs to adapt and allow for 3rd party devices/applications so that it can remain competitive.

Selected Answer: AC
A & C are correct

Selected Answer: AC
Makes sense coz sdks supply apis for software development projects

Chat GPT is actually right in this instance:
while option D is a valid feature of Cisco DNA Center, it’s important to note that the question specifically asked for capabilities that make Cisco DNA Center more extensible. While modularity does provide benefits, it doesn’t necessarily make the system more extensible in the same way that REST APIs and SDKs do, as these allow for interaction with external applications and third-party network equipment respectively. Therefore, options A and C are generally considered the best answers to this question.
is that A true ? focus on (nativly) REST APIs that allow for external applications to interact natively

Selected Answer: AD
A. REST APIs: Traditional campus device management relied on vendor-specific protocols and interfaces, limiting extensibility. Cisco DNA Center's open REST APIs allow external applications and tools to easily integrate and interact with network data, enabling automation, custom workflows, and deeper network insights.

D. Modular design: DNA Center's modular architecture allows adding new functionalities through additional applications and integrations. Unlike monolithic systems, this modularity enables customization and adaptation to specific needs without replacing the entire platform, making it future-proof and more extensible.

Option C is incorrect because SDKs that support interaction with third-party network equipment is not a capability that makes Cisco DNA Center more extensible as compared to traditional campus device management.

Selected Answer: AC
Given are correct

questions.question_text: Which two capabilities of Cisco DNA Center make it more extensible as compared to traditional campus device management? (Choose two.)

choices.C: SDKs that support interaction with third-party network equipment
choices.B: adapters that support all families of Cisco IOS software
choices.A: REST APIs that allow for external applications to interact natively
choices.D: modular design that is upgradable as needed
choices.E: customized versions for small, medium, and large enterprises

discussion.content: Doing things nicely and easily = DNA

discussion.content:
The control plane is the part of a network that controls how data is forwarded, while the data plane controls the actual forwarding process.
Making packet forwarding decisions is ‘how data is forwarded’.
ANSWER = B

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

comments.content: actually you are right. Also I confused this point
Bu I noticed now. The question had said "assist"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Pls correct me if i'm wrong.
The control plane PROVIDE the layer 2 reachability and layer 3 routing information to assist the forwarding decisions in the data plane. It doesn't mean that the control plane MAKE the forwarding decision, only provide the tables and databases to data plane.

Thanks!

comments.content: the device is configured and monitored in management plane

discussion.content:
C. controller-based allows for fewer network failures, while traditional increases failure rates
D. controller-based provides centralization of key IT functions, while traditional requires distributed management functions

Regarding the controller-based network, A and E are not benefits.
I don't know if C is true, but B and D are. 

So B and D

comments.content:
Regarding the controller-based network, A and E are not benefits.
I don't know if C is true, but B and D are.

So B and D
C is not true , none of them can reduce a network failures.
Agreed we dont know if a team of techs are dumb or not. So c is out.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B & D are correct
reduces network complexity and centralised key IT functions. end of story
C would make sense because it reduces the possibility for human error to cause an outage but B is more obvious and it also includes the issue with errors in the answer.
Guys, Cisco itself has shared some numbers that show that a Controller-Based network does help your network to have fewer network errors throughout the time.

comments.content: Controller based can have fewer network errors than traditional networking while configuration. Answer C takes about network failures and not configuration errors which should not increase or decrease with the use of controllers.

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of controller-based networking compared to traditional networking? (Choose two.)

choices.B: controller-based reduces network configuration complexity, while traditional increases the potential for errors
choices.D: controller-based provides centralization of key IT functions, while traditional requires distributed management functions
choices.C: controller-based allows for fewer network failures, while traditional increases failure rates
choices.E: controller-based inflates software costs, while traditional decreases individual licensing costs
choices.A: controller-based increases network bandwidth usage, while traditional lightens the load on the network

questions.question_text: Which type of API allows SDN controllers to dynamically make changes to the network?

Answer is D
Cisco overview doc for SDN here: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/Enterprise/Data_Center/VMDC/SDN/SDN.html

however I recommend everyone to spend 40 mins watching any of the (non-vendor specific) fundamentals of SDN/Openflow vids on YT...my personal rec is David Mahler's stuff

(fact is nowadays if you don't know some SDN basics you just won't be getting jobs anymore!!)

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
Southbound APIs facilitate control over the network and enable the SDN Controller to DYNAMICALLY MAKE CHANGES according to real-time demands and needs.
